PATIENT_ID: TEST_NAT_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-26 08:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-26 08:10:00
2-year-old male brought by mother. Suspected non-accidental trauma.
NAT evaluation initiated. Child abuse suspected based on injury pattern.
History provided by mother: reported fall from couch.
Historian: mother. Injury history inconsistent with developmental age.
Age: 2 years. Developmental age assessment: ambulatory, pre-verbal.

[ED_NOTE] 2026-01-26 08:20:00
Complete head-to-toe physical examination performed.
Multiple bruises in various stages of healing noted on torso and extremities.
Bruising identified on back and buttocks inconsistent with reported mechanism.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-26 08:45:00
CT head obtained: no acute intracranial hemorrhage.
Skeletal survey performed: healing rib fractures bilateral, age 2-4 weeks.
Abdominal imaging negative for solid organ injury.

[LAB] 2026-01-26 08:50:00
CBC, CMP, coagulation studies all within normal limits.
No coagulopathy identified.

[CONSULT_NOTE] 2026-01-26 09:00:00
Social Work consultation obtained immediately upon NAT suspicion.
SW consult documented. Social work notified and responded.
CPS notified and reported per policy. Law enforcement contacted.
Ophthalmology evaluation requested. Medical photography performed.
Admission for ongoing NAT evaluation and safety concerns.
